parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.title: Parque Nacional Lençóis Maranhenses - Lagoa Azul
parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.description: The Lençóis Maranhenses National Park (Parque Nacional dos Lençóis Maranhenses) is a national park located in Maranhão state, in northeastern Brazil. It is an area of low, flat, occasionally flooded land, overlaid with large, discrete sand dunes. It encompasses roughly 1,500 km2 (580 sq mi), and despite abundant rain, supports almost no vegetation. The area became a National Park on June 2, 1981.

parque-estadual-ilha-do-mel.title: Parque Estadual Ilha do Mel
parque-estadual-ilha-do-mel.description: The Ilha do Mel State Park (Parque Estadual da Ilha do Mel) is a state park in the state of Paraná, Brazil, located in the southern part of the island Ilha do Mel, at the entrance of Paranaguá Bay. The park, created in 2002, has an area of about 393 hectares (970 acres) and protects beaches, rocky cliffs, areas of marine influence, salt marshes, remnants of dense submontane Atlantic Forest and lowland restinga forest, archaeological sites as middens, and the rich fauna of the island.

parque-nacional-da-serra-da-bocaina.title: Parque Nacional da Serra da Bocaina
parque-nacional-da-serra-da-bocaina.description: Serra da Bocaina National Park is a national park of Brazil. It is located at the border between the states of Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo in southeastern Brazil. It comprises an area of approximately 104,000 hectares (260,000 acres) and a significant biodiversity. It is estimated that 60% of the vegetation is composed of native Atlantic Forest, and the rest is forest regenerated for over 30 years. The highest point is Pico do Tira o Chapéu, which reaches 2,088 metres (6,850 ft)

parque-nacional-do-itatiaia.title: Parque Nacional do Itatiaia
parque-nacional-do-itatiaia.description: The Itatiaia National Park is a Brazilian conservation unit of integral nature protection located in the Itatiaia massif, in the Mantiqueira mountain range, between the states of Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais. Itatiaia is the oldest national park in Brazil.

parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.title: Parque Nacional Lençóis Maranhenses - Lagoa Bonita
parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.description: The Lençóis Maranhenses National Park (Parque Nacional dos Lençóis Maranhenses) is a national park located in Maranhão state, in northeastern Brazil. It is an area of low, flat, occasionally flooded land, overlaid with large, discrete sand dunes. It encompasses roughly 1,500 km2 (580 sq mi), and despite abundant rain, supports almost no vegetation. The area became a National Park on June 2, 1981.

parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.title: Parque Nacional Lençóis Maranhenses - Lagoa da Esperança
parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-lago.description: The Lençóis Maranhenses National Park (Parque Nacional dos Lençóis Maranhenses) is a national park located in Maranhão state, in northeastern Brazil. parque-nacional-da-restinga-de-jurubatib.title: Parque Nacional da Restinga de Jurubatiba
parque-nacional-da-restinga-de-jurubatib.description: The Jurubatiba Sandbank National Park (Portuguese: Parque Nacional da Restinga de Jurubatiba) is a national park in the Brazilian state of Rio de Janeiro created on 29th July of 1998. The park has approximately 44 kilometres of sandbank coast.

mirante-do-ultimo-adeus-parque-nacional-.title: Mirante do Ultimo Adeus - Parque Nacional do Itatiaia
mirante-do-ultimo-adeus-parque-nacional-.description: The Itatiaia National Park is a Brazilian conservation unit of integral nature protection located in the Itatiaia massif, in the Mantiqueira mountain range, between the states of Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais. Itatiaia is the oldest national park in Brazil. The Mirante do Último Adeus (portuguese for Last Goodbye Viewpoint) offers a panoramic view of the Campo Belo and Serra do Mar valley.

parque-nacional-da-serra-dos-orgaos-guap.title: Parque Nacional da Serra dos Orgãos - Guapimirim
parque-nacional-da-serra-dos-orgaos-guap.description: Serra dos Órgãos National Park (Portuguese: Parque Nacional da Serra dos Órgãos: "Organs Range") is a national park in the state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It protects the Serra dos Órgãos mountain range and the water sources in the range. It was the third national park to be created in Brazil. The Park's area is 10,527 hectares (26,010 acres). It has ten peaks higher than 2,000 metres (6,600 ft).

parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-sant.title: Parque Nacional Lençóis Maranhenses - Santo Amaro
parque-nacional-lencois-maranhenses-sant.description: The Lençóis Maranhenses National Park (Parque Nacional dos Lençóis Maranhenses) is a national park located in Maranhão state, in northeastern Brazil. parque-nacional-da-serra-dos-orgaos-tere.title: Parque Nacional da Serra dos Orgãos - Teresópolis
parque-nacional-da-serra-dos-orgaos-tere.description: Serra dos Órgãos National Park (Portuguese: Parque Nacional da Serra dos Órgãos: "Organs Range") is a national park in the state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It protects the Serra dos Órgãos mountain range and the water sources in the range. It was the third national park to be created in Brazil. The Park's area is 10,527 hectares (26,010 acres). It has ten peaks higher than 2,000 metres (6,600 ft).

parque-nacional-do-iguacu-rio-iguacu.title: Parque Nacional do Iguaçu - Rio Iguaçu
parque-nacional-do-iguacu-rio-iguacu.description: Iguaçu National Park is a national park in Paraná State, Brazil. It comprises a total area of 185,262.5 hectares (457,794 acres). The Iguaçu National Park owes its name to the fact it includes an important area of the Iguazu River. This river is 1,320 kilometres (820 mi) long and approximately 50 square kilometres (19 sq mi) of its length makes up the Iguaçu Falls.
